item.description: Wanted: ALIVE Seems there's enough of us to formalize this trip. RSVP, drive or ride. Should be good as always. Although it starts at 6:30, we might want to decide on eating at the restaraunt at the hotel before the seminar. So leaving FIT no later than 5 might do it. -------------------------------------------------------- -------------------(Boston/Bedford Glen) 44 Middlesex Turnpike Bedford, MA 01730 Hotel Phone: (781) 275-5500 Located at what used to be the Renaissance Bedford Hotel. Free Parking: Bear right at the driveway fork to the conference area parking and entrance. If the lot fills, use parking in front of or on opposite side of the hotel. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------Please join the Aero Club of New England for our special 2012 edition of Crash Course. This year's program will include an expanded 45-minute review of local accidents, followed by the debut of the Air Safety Institute's newest seminar. Be among the very first to benefit from this new program, Wanted: Alive! Reining in the Fatal Accident Rate. The general aviation accident rate is not dropping, and pilots continue to find themselves in the same accident-causing scenarios that have been plaguing them for years. Join us as we discuss the top pilot-related accident categories, why they are what they are, and how you can avoid falling into them!------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------- Qualifies toward FAA WINGS credit and AOPA Accident Forgiveness. FREE ADMISSION • FREE PARKING NO RESERVATIONS REQUIRED CASH BAR • VENDOR EXHIBIT • DOOR & RAFFLE PRIZES -----------------------------Agenda   6:30-7:15 PM Social Hour with Cash Bar and Sponsor Exhibits 7:15-7:20 PM Welcome, Introductions 7:20-7:30 PM Amy Corbett, New England Regional  Administrator 7:30-8:15 PM Expanded Review of Local Accidents 8:15-9:15 PM Air Safety Institute: Wanted: Alive! Reining in the Fatal Accident Rate 9:15 PM --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Door & Raffle Prize Drawings Principal Sponsorship by: Aero Club of New England • Air Safety Institute • FAA Aviation Safety Program Special Thanks to Crash Course Sponsors: AirShares Elite • Aviation Insurance Agency • Aviation Medical Exams • Avidyne • Cape Air/Nantucket Airlines • Columbia Aircraft Sales • David Clark • East Coast Aero Club  • Executive Flyers • Falcon Air • Garmin • King Aviation Mansfield • Nashua Flight Simulator • Signature Flight Support • UBS Wealth Management Make safety a priority!  The Air Safety Institute is a division of the AOPA Foundation. Air Safety Institute  421 Aviation Way | Frederick, MD 21701-4798 | 800-872-2672 | www.Air
